thread.title: Local Roundup: Bishop Noll volleyball wins share of first league title in 21 years - Post-Tribune
thread.title_full: Local Roundup: Bishop Noll volleyball wins share of first league title in 21 years - Post-Tribune

author: Ryan Haskell
title: Local Roundup: Bishop Noll volleyball wins share of first league title in 21 years - Post-Tribune
text:
Bishop Noll can start thinking about a conference championship patch for its volleyball players' jackets for the first time in 21 years after a Greater South Shore Conference sweep, 25-22, 25-10, 25-8, at Wheeler Thursday night.
And with a team loaded with freshmen and sophomores, it could rule the conference for years to come.
But first things first.
The Warriors (19-6, 7-0) want to win the conference championship outright when they take on North Newton next Thursday.
Noll's last conference championship came in 1994 as a member of the Lake 10 Conference.
"This is very cool," coach Dave Rodriguez said. "The reason why it was always about sectionals and regionals and the state tournament before was because we weren't winning conference championships. Now that we've won one, it's about conference championships and it's really awesome."
Birthday girl Bella Kuechenberg, who had 14 kills and four aces, was serenaded with the "Happy Birthday" song by her teammates after the win.
Post-Tribune Volleyball Stats Tim O'Brien, Post-Tribune All the area's statistical leaders in kills, solo blocks, assists, service points, aces and digs. Check back each week to see where you and your favorite team stack up.

(Tim O'Brien, Post-Tribune) "It's amazing," the 16-year-old sophomore said of the league title. "It's a good feeling to think we've accomplished something so big.
"We started off slow, but the (Wheeler) fans got me really angry and then we got all rambunctious and we all came together."
Noll led 19-7 in Game 1 before letting the Bearcats back in the contest.
"We've been trying to play real clean, methodical volleyball because we can't afford to give away points against anybody," he said. "That's why we struggled in Game 1. We had 12 errors in the first and nine in the last two games."
But the Warriors stepped it up at the service line and put the Bearcats on their heels for Games 2 and 3.
Freshmen Alex Fortuna was especially effective rolling off three straight aces during a 6-0 run in Game 2. She finished with a match-high seven aces.
Kuechenberg tore it up at the line in Game 3, scoring the game's final seven points recording aces for points 20, 22, 23 and 24.
The Bearcats (17-6, 5-2) looked overmatched the final two games.
"The first game was the team I saw against Munster Monday night," Wheeler coach Alisha Brown said. "We struggled (the last two games). They exploited our serve receive and that was it."
Noll senior libero Delaney Soto kept the defense strong with nine digs, while junior Brittany Anderson contributed 20 assists, six digs, five kills and three aces.
Rodriguez said his team is not done, though.
"This is a big deal because it hasn't happened in 21 years." He said. "But it's still just a share and we want to go out and do it the right way."
Wheeler was led by Allison Stills (6 kills), Shawn McKenna (3 aces, 7 digs) and Belle Bravo (14 assists).
Wheeler seeks swim coach: Wheeler High School is seeking a girls swimming head coach. For more information, call athletic director Randy Stelter at (219) 759-2561, ext. 2237.
